content: knit one row and bind off purlwise using larger needle crocheted shell edging with rs of work facing use slip_stitch to attach cc to edge of afghan approx 0 5 inch from upper left corner work will proceed toward this corner before continuing around the perimeter of the afghan it may be necessary to start this row a few different times to figure out the best spacing of stitches you may prefer to practice on a swatch first round 1 chain 1 work 2 single_crochet to corner single_crochet in corner continue to work single_crochet around edge of afghan working an extra single_crochet into each corner slip_stitch in 1st single_crochet to join end of round p age | 3 round 2 *skip 2 single_crochet work 9 double_crochet in corner st skip 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet skip 2 single_crochet 6 double_crochet in next single_crochet skip 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet to approx 2 single_crochet before next corner st* repeat from * to * 3 times more slip_stitch in slip_stitch at beginning of row when approaching a corner stitch it may be necessary to skip more or less than 2 stitches in order to work into the corner stitch count ahead finishing in order to get your afghan to lie flat you will need to wet block it the easiest way to do this is to fill your washer with warm water and a no-rinse wool wash put the afghan in and let it soak about half an hour set your dial on the machine to spin the water out smooth the wet afghan out using your hands measuring the sides and evening them up let it dry completely before moving a fan is helpful pattern support email - laylor13@gmail com ravelry shop - http //www ravelry com/designers/laura-aylor ©2006 by laura aylor all rights reserved p age | 4
